Finally, it means giving people of color a voice by increasing diversity in all areas of our society ‚Äì from media and entertainment to Congress and our nation‚Äôs highest court. /5

We have made great progress in this fight, but there is still much work to be done to ensure communities of color are fully and equitably represented in this country. /2

Those who breached the Capitol on January 6th were not patriots.

Real patriotism is standing up to the misinformation and hatred they carried with them as they attacked our democracy that day. /5

Meanwhile, thousands of insurrectionists were forcing their way into the Capitol.

Many of them were assaulting police officers and breaking in windows and doors ‚Äì all to stop Congress from certifying the results of a presidential election that they didn‚Äôt like. /4

I knew something wasn‚Äôt right, so I left the Capitol to go back to my office.

We barricaded our doors, turned off all the lights, and clutched baseball bats to protect ourselves in case our office was raided by the mob. /3

On the afternoon of January 6, 2021, I was in the Capitol working to certify the results of the presidential election.

I could hear the protesters outside getting louder and louder. We started to get reports of exterior police barricades being breached. /2
üßµ A year ago today, our country was tested when thousands of insurrectionists forced their way into the U.S. Capitol, shattering 244 years of peaceful transitions of power. 1/
